div.p: For myself, it tends to take effort to put my thoughts into linear form (to write an article, a blog post, or an e-mail) if I want it to "sound good". But for some, writing is easy.

For reasons I won't go into here, (one day) my brother was inside of a vehicle for an extended period of time. I think he was bored an wanted someone to talk to. Here's his text message to me (that was meant jokingly):

blockquote.p: Day 4: The outside world is becoming one of mystery to me... a distant memory. I do wonder what the outside world is like... being stuck in this cell. This cell might be 8.5' x 5'... but it only has a 4.5' ceiling height. It feels more like an obese man's casket than a cell. The walls feel like they're closing in... I don't know how much more I can take this. I send this message out to all that I can reach... in hopes that maybe someone will help my sanity.

div.p: Obviously, he's metaphorically comparing the vehicle he's in to a prison cell.
My brother's jovial text messages to me (which he writes without effort) sound much more eloquent than my usual style of writing. To me (at least) it sounds like "novel quality".
He followed that up with another one:

blockquote.p: Time sure moves slowly in here. Wish I knew what day it is... something most people take for granted. I watched the sun rise and now it looks as if its going to fall... yet time escapes me. It all looks the same in here. I try to keep time by scratching lines on the wall... but when I fall asleep I miss adding some of the lines. Which leaves me where I am now... in the vast unknown. Has time stopped or has it kept going...

div.p: His effortless joking text messages sound better than my effortful articles.
